text: Clear deep amber hue with noticeable floaties and a lasting ivory head. Bready saison like aroma with some mild fruity esters and a semisweet dark wheat tone. Smooth mellow flavor thats dark wheaty, slightly fruity, has a little kiss of orange and clove, with a smooth booze phenol warmth at the bready sweet end. Not shabby, but theres too many floaties that Im concerned over.
Experten: "Nyanserad, kryddig smak med liten sötma, inslag av aprikosmarmelad, sirapslimpa, kanel, kandisocker och pomerans." Amatören: "Jag kunde inte *hick* ha sagt det bättre *hick* själv!"

Pours clear amber, very little foam. Sweet autumn fruits aroma, bit of sugary and frostbitten pears, sweet and with a bitter edge. Taste is creamy, sweet and has some pumpkin spices for some reason. Small alcohol kick there as well but nothing too serious. Decent example of the style, malty, drinks easier than it should. Not overly sweet, which is a good thing in my book.
Pours a cloudy amber with a short-lived white head. Lots of caramel and spice present in this unfiltered wheat ale. Definitely recommend this one.

Bottle picked up from Wine Rack at Yarnton Nurseries, Yarnton, Oxon, consumed at home Sunday 19th March 2017 whilst cooking Fish Pies and Voodoo Pizzas.  Hazy amber with not much of a head, a little boozy, wheaty, some banana toffee, soft in the mouth, fruity a touch of spice. This is decent infact most beers that ive had from Victory are very good, however not desparately exciting.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a amber colour beer with a medium head. Malty and yeasty with sweet banana and notes of chocolate. Dry finish
Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Rather clear amber pour with a fluffy head. Notes of pears, banana, prunes, light herbal, spice and some light hops.

330 ml bottle at Greenwich Union. Pours hazy copper, yeast floating, small, short-lived head. Aroma mostly of nuts, warm, some dough and alcohol present. Very nice taste, sweet, ripe fruits. Medium-bodied. Very good beer in overall, but could be more weizen-y for my taste.

From bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours a hazy rusty amber with a small eggshell head. Aroma has toffee, bubblegum, light hops, estery, banana, wheaty malts. Taste is sweet and sticky, light boozy, hint of hoppy bitterness towards the end. Very yeasty. Oily, fluffy texture and a smooth carbonation.
Aroma is malty, red fruits, light strawberries and honey. Taste copies the aroma a bit with some banana as well. A soft sting from alcohol in the end,
Sweet fudgy aroma, bit of banana, Kind of like banana cake. Hints of chocolate. Taste is sweet, alchoholic with some phenols. To phenolic for my taste.
Bottle from Glug, Newcastle. Hazy amber coloured with a thin white head. It has a spicy toffee apple and dried fruit flavour followed by a warming vanilla and currant, smooth finish. Very good.

Ganska mörk med smutsvitt skum. Smått tungdrucken och krallig. Jäst, kryddig, torkad frukt, bröd.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet malt aroma. Initial taste covers your mouth in a rich cascade of smooth bubbles. The sweet malt is top with a subtle burn.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ljusbrun i färgen. Fyllig smak med en söt karaktär. Lite åt banan men balanserad åt barley wine hållet

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle on 12/28. Pours a dark red maroon cloud. Aroma of banana. Taste is banana, some clove, caramel, some light bitterness. Light medium carbonation, over medium body. Lingering aftertaste.
light malt aroma. dark amber and slightly hazy in color with nice long lasting head. taste is of light to medium crystal malts and hints of citrus.

Lukt: Søtlige bringebær, anelse syrlighet.
Utseende: Rødbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Nesten ikke skum.
Smak: Søtlig bringebær, anelse syrlig avslutning.
Hvor: Tasting kveld Hjemme med Bryne.

Pretty nice weizen, bananas, clove, sweet cookie dough, pretty chewy mouthfeel.
Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Lasting beige head. Clear copper colored. Spicy and mild caramell aroma but no banana. Full body and mild bitterness.
Mörkt bärnstensfärgad öl med ett smutsvitt skum. Doft av banan, jäst och övermogen frukt. I smaken kommer frukten fram ännu mer, tillsammans med lättare kryddiga toner.

Bottle from The Hippo Taproom. Hazy amber body with loads of yeast flecks floating beneath a thin off-white head that fades. Aroma of honey, mince pie, banana bread and caramel. Flavour of red apple, raisins and peppery malt. Medium body with a sticky texture. Soft fizz. Sweet and warming. A decent Weizenbock but not as complex or concentrated as the best ones Ive tried.

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, banany, karmel, chleb, alkohol. Kolor miedziany, mętne. Piana niska, drobna, szybko znika, lekki lacing. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, karmel, przyprawy, banany, chleb, cukier, alkohol. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.

Pours murky red amber with low off white head
Aromas of wheat, banana candy, spices, sweet fruits, caramel
Taste has notes of wheat, bread, phenols. sweet fruits, spices, bananas
Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied, sweet, average carbonation and low bitter finish

Bottle from web SB cons 2016-11-30 Göteborg 
AR: banana foam, wee caramel, sweet yeasty 
AP: hazy amber, wee thin deminishing white head
F; rich carbonated, caramel, banana foam, soaked sugar cake, very sweet mouthfeel
Flaska. Kopparfärgad med ett långvarigt smutsvitt skum. Dofter av banan, vete och örter. Smakinslag av banan, karamell, vete och örter. Medel mot liten kropp. Örtig och fruktig avslutning.

Hel klar, djupt bärnstens färgad, orange-ljus brunt litet och snabbt försvinnande skum. Doft: Mjöl, svagt svagt av cognac, svagt av päron-äpple, trä, alkohol. Smak: Som doft -mjöl +konstgjord frukt, mjöliga skumbananer, röda godis båtar.
On tap at bitter Creek boise. Pours out a amber copper topped with a white head. Nose is nice belg candy malts sweetness banana spice. Taste is more of the nice banana spice notes and candy malts.
@ Agards v?g 15/11-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty and overripe fruity with esters, also caramely and sweet. Body is medium, the finish is sweet, caramely and overripe fruity with esters.

2016-10-07 Sample from bottle @ Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival. Taste of dried fruits, marmalade, sugar and honey. Not that sweet though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruity and spicy aroma, full of caramel. Yeast, lemon, and bitter herbs taste. Somewhat sour finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber color with a fine tan head. Ok intensity in the aroma. But some unpleasant yeast notes. Medium + body and a soft carbonation level. Balanced sweetness. Oily texture. Yeast (unpleasant), toffee and dried fruits in the flavor.[Bottle from Dag. Bought at Systembolaget in Sweden]
@ Havregatan 20161111. Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, fruity and estery, caramely, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, sweet and estery.

Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad, lite disig, lite kletig med ganska lågt skum. Klassisk vetebock. Stor kropp, balanserad sötma med lite vetesyrlighet, Banan, nejlikor, vetedeg, syltaade apelsinskal med för stilen tydligt markerad apelsinsskalsbeska. Aningen alkohol slår igenom annars fin.

355ml bottle. Murky dark amber to light brown with one finger tan head. Aroma of wheat, banana, cloves, mixed bread spices and something almost ginger-like. Taste is similar with sweet banana, wheat, mixed spiciness, cloves, the same ginger tone and some alcohol. Smooth medium to filling mouthfeel, light carbonation and somewhat stuffy spicy wheat aftertaste.
Bottle at home courtesy of Kirsty. A odd red colour. Not much head. A bit thinish.
Bottle at Stephens.... Copper... Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet toffee fruit nose... Soft sweet toffee fruit.. Light sweet banana toffee fruit.. Bitter herbal fruit
Gylden klar med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter urter, brent karamell og rosiner. Søt smak, svisker, brent karamell, litt pepperig og noe anis. Middels lang, middels bitterhet.
Nötbrun, lätt molnig. Skummet lägger sig snabbt. Luktar lätt jäst. Smakar lite mycket alkohol, men rätt ok
Kopparfärgad oklar med vit skum. Doftar och smakar lite citrus, belgiskt och maltigt. Ganska mycket alkoholsmak och beska

Caramel, fruity, jam, alcohol, vanilla, butterscotch, wheat, lightly roasty.
Deep amber colour, small beige head.
Big sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly salty, ABV well integrated.
Medium/fullbodied, fizzy carbonation, sweet and warming finish.
Solid.
Bottle from SB. Hazy reddish amber with a small off white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt, hops and caramel. Medium to full body with a bitter / fruity finish.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy mahogany, medium size, white head that disappears quickly, leaving weak lacing. Strong alcohol in the aroma, and behind it some sweet dried fruit, cloves and boiled vegetables. Medium bodied, soft carbonated, sweet and smooth mouthfeel. Sweet taste caramel, dried fruit, clove, banana, red apple and alcohol. Sweet and warming finish.
Flaska från SB. Bärnstensfärgad med orangevitt skum. Söt doft av karramemalt, banan och pumpernickel. Söt och lite sträv kropp. Smak av vetemalt, knäck, banan, ananas, peppar, alkohol och trä.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Hazy amber with little head. Sweet weaty aroma with weaty malty taste.
Nose is rich and malty with clear wheat character. Colour is dark amber and the taste is sweetish with malty notes. Palate is long and warming.

Slightly hazy light nutbrown. Very little off white head. Aroma of marzipan, banana, walnuts and alcohol. Nice aroma. Round full bodied beer with prickely carbonation. Taste is syrupy sweet and lightly sour. Nice beer.

355 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark amber with a small off-white head. Strong fruity aroma of citrus,dried fruits, strawberry jam, caramel, peppery yeast, banana and alcohol. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body, average carbonation and quite bittersweet finish.

Pours hazy caramel with a medium frothy off white head. Aromas of ripe bananas, caramel, marinated fruit, raisins, toffee. Taste is caramel sweetness with tropical fruit and some almond notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Flaska systembolaget. Matt mahognyfärgad vätska. Doft av äpplemos, blommor och jäst. Småsöt smak med len munkänsla. Örter, övermoget äpple och lite kakdeg.
Clear, deep red colour, some white lacing. Mild aroma, some malts. Bitter taste, malty. Smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Decent.
A lush weizenbock swirling with candied apples, cinnamon and maraschino cherries.
Flaska från SB.Smak och doft av äpple, brunt socker, marsipan, grön banan med toner av halstablett. Oljig, rund och len, stor kropp, lagom sötma, bra balans, fin beska. Mycket gott i lagom mängder!

The few beers Ive had from Victory Brewing have all been fairly impressive, and this is no different. Dark amber-ruby pour, cloudy and with small beige head. Big nose with typical wheat beer hints together with toffee/caramel maltiness, wet wool, foam bananas and some herbs. The palate has good body and structure. An almost slightly tart quality together with some sweetness and a big, malty, wheaty backbone makes this a very interesting, low bitterness beer.
Bottle. Pours a reddish brown color with white head. Clove, yeast, bread, dough, slight caramel aromas. Toast, yeast, clove, bread flavors. Very solid
Tap at Tommyknockers, Helsinki. Colour is clear dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Grain, bread, biscuit, sweetness, syrup and malts. Strong flavors but too sweet for me.
Bottle - pours amber red with a big clingy head. Aroma is dried fruit, a bit of spice, apple and banana. Taste is sweet dried fruit up front with a banana and esters finish.

Draught at WilliamK. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, wheat, a bit of alcohol, ripe fruits, grass and nuts. Bitter finish with citrus, caramel, hops, caramel, ripe fruits, wheat, grass and nuts. Excellent weizenbock.

Draught @Tommyknocker. 
Poured brown color with a thick white head. 
Ripe fruity, mould, esters, banana in aroma. 
Mild glue at first, later disappeared. 
Flavor has ripe fruits, berries, banana sweetness, malts. Sticky, heavy.

Keg (Tommyknockers, Helsinki)
Scarily sweet aroma, crusts of banana bread. Palate sweet and full, but not too heavy and sticky. Very sweet taste, banana lower than aroma, malty, but messy, slight sour bite later. Nope.

(Keg at Tommyknocker, 20161013) The beer poured brown and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had excessive sweetness, treacle and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, more sweetness, treacle, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet. An excessively sweet pointless brew.

1/2 pint on tap @ One Pint Pub, shared with wiosna. Pours clear deep golden with a low head. Aroma is sweet malts with some alcohol. Flavor is sweet malts, wheat, some mild banana, alcohol and hops. Doesnt even try to hide the ABV, but that doesnt really matter. Good.
Bottle at festival. Pours hazy copper. Aroma and flavor are bready malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, clove, and banana. Medium body.

355ml Bottle - Hazy copper red in colour. Raisins, sultanas, caramel, marzipan and berries in the aroma. Sultanas, caramel, banana and berries in the taste. Not too bad and has some unique flavours compared to most of the weizenbocks I have tried.

Hazy, copper red beer and one finger high head. 

Nose: Caramel, red berries, honey, brown sugar, dried fruit, nuts and toffee. 
Taste: Syrup, brown sugar, banana, almond and dried fruit. 
Mouth: Medium body. Smooth carbonation. Sweet and a little sour ending.

Flaska från SB. Rödaktig, nästan lite mahogny med tunt vitt skum. Söt doft av blöt kartong, kanderat äpple, brunt socker. Oerhört stor, fyllig och oljig kropp som sväller i munnen. Sött i smaken som ligger nära doften. Mäktig, och blöt kartong och äpple dominerar. Kanske skulle göras bra av lagring?

From a bottle. Pours hazy amber with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like dried fruits, booze, earthy, nutty malt, banana, and wheat. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like dried fruits, booze, earthy, and nutty malt.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Murat amber with a small head. 
Yeasty, estery, spicy, sweet aroma. 
Thick and slightly alcoholic mouthfeel. 
Caramel, liquorice, spicies in the flavour.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2017 Bärnstensfärgad, disig med gräddvitt skum. Stor doft med banan, aprikos och diverse kryddor som kanel och ingefära. Smaken är söt och kryddig med banan och en massa torkade frukter, ett sting av ingefära kommer på slutet och ger balans åt sötman. En riktigt häftig vetebock.

Tap @ Konttori.
Pours clear mahogany red color with a small head. Sweet banana on the nose, caramel, toffee, spice notes and wheat, alcohol comes through a bit. Sweet malty flavor with spice notes, caramel, ripe fruits, some berry things going on here too. Medium carbonation. Slightly too sweet, otherwise decent.
4434
Tap @ Konttori. Pours hazy ruby red, thick beige head. Banana, caramel in the aroma. Sweet, banana, thick caramel flavor.
Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Sweet and fruity smell with banans and some caramel. Similar taste. Noticeable alcohol.

Tap. I thought Id rated this a billion years ago and actually looked this up to see what my old score was...apparently I havent rated it formally. Turbid dark copper brown. Light clove, allspice, slight banana and hay in the aroma. Touch of tangy fruit, caramel, slight clove and grass in the flavor. Medium to heavier body.

This is a really nice beer to look at and to smell. I got hit with caramel notes right away and its got a nice malty taste, but it doesnt linger. Its nice, and then it kind of fades away. Good beer, but didnt knock my socks off because it feels kind of temporary.
Pours hazy light brown, good sized tan head. Aroma of toffee, banana, hint of apple juice. Aroma is more toffee, and dark fruits, raisin, less obvious wheat. Mouthfeel is heavy, moderate carbonation.

355 ml bottle. Hazy orange-amber with a tightly packed off-white head. Aromas of banana, raisins, cinnamon, ginger biscuits and orange peel. Starts out with a lot of sweet dried fruit but thats soon overtaken by a firm orange and pepper spice note. Relatively dry finish leads into a spicy aftertaste. Impressive.
I usually go for the trappist-style beer but thought Id branch out. This is one amazing brew!
Vintage Cellars ontap(29-Jun-16)Banana malt aroma.Dark amber,low head&suds lace.Banana candy flavour.Banana berry finish&light chilli after.
Floral hop spice aroma. Murky deep Amber colour good head and lacing. Herbal spice malt flavour. Smooth palate.

Aroma: big banana giving way to surgery malt and spirit.

App: tea amber, clear small white head 

Flavour: malt and banana with balanced hop

Palate: short finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours very rosy Amber. Aroma of candied banana, saltines and caramel. Flavour of clove with much more subdued banana than you expect when you smell it. Very enjoyable, very full, very drinkable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy, orange, frothy, tan foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

Clear Amber with thin white head. 
Banana, raisin, and honey aromas. 
Sweet with a light sourness. 
Apple, banana, and spice flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice dunkelweisen. Pours a very nice deep Amber with a white head. Smells of banana, berries, vanilla. Taste is smooth and sweet, with lots of berries and banana, and a bit of vanilla. Well-balanced. Had in the bottle.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 DATE: April 22, 2016... OCCASION: Cavs up 3-0, Joeys first tee ball game, and a better end to the school day than expected... GLASSWARE: Schneiders Weisen pokal... APPEARANCE: the glass divides into a robust copper body that houses a lazy effervescence and a thick, craggy, resistant white head that pillows nicely... AROMA: fragrant, earthy spiciness suggests hops, though the main aroma is an astringent vapor that says 8.7% up front... banana and clove, yes... PALATE: slick, medium-bodied, vibrant body that leaves a tingling at the throat... the aftertaste lingers, but pleasantly so... TASTE: banana and clove, with the bread and toast of a malt-forward beer... enough fruitiness--apple, plum--to complicate the profile.... slightly acidic and sweet--challenging to nail down, but enjoyable in its weight and strength... OVERALL: another victory for Victory--an autumn glory that rises in the spring, and shows enough complexity to encourage the next sip... BIG but balanced and packaged in a palatable way...

Bottle from Beer Cartel 080416. This really is a great beer that is dark in colour with a thick coffee coloured foam cap. Great flavour with a full body and long aftertaste with a big kick of alcohol to finish off.

Large beige head strong carbonation misty red brown pour aromas caramel banana rich wheat sugary sweet note clove toffee the flavours sweet hop grain pleasing tastes caramel grain richness spices sweet strong good body toffee the finish best aftertastes spice rich malt grain so enjoyable

It is amber that is slightly on the dark side. It has a moussy, tan head. It is hazy and cloudy. It has aromas of bread, plums, and a bit of vanilla. It also has an alcohol aroma. As it warms, the aroma of banana and raisins become evident. It has rich, bread malt flavors with a spicy, clove element. There is moderate wheat flavors and banana. There is a faint tart bite with a sherry like quality that adds to the overall complexity of the beer. It has a medium full body. There is a pleasant warming sensation. It also is highly carbonated.
Appearance is hazy amber with a medium white head. Aroma is spices. Taste is a blend of spices, warm alcohol, and a touch of bitterness. Overall good and balanced.

bottle - Pours hazy amber with a two finger head. It smells of yeast, cloves, and bananas. It tastes sweet with a yeasty character, spices, caramel, and wheat. Medium bodied. Mild bitterness. The high abv is a little surprising as its well concealed.

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours copper with a big and fluffy off-white and lacing. The aroma is banana, clove, yeast, and spice. The taste is banana, chocolate, spice, bread, and some hop bitterness. Its smooth with nice carbonation. This is pretty tasty with a nice balance of flavors.
Pours a cloudy brown colour with a large light brown head. Aroma is malt, wheat, fruit, citrus, yeast and alcohol. Taste is high sweet.

From a 355ml bottle on 24/2/2016. Pours amber with a medium head. Has a a light banana nose with some spice in the mix. The flavour is sweet and fruity (more banana), with cloves, rye bread and light spices. Has a fullish body, a slick texture and relatively lively carbonation. Drinks a lot light than 8.7%. Pretty solid if not particularly remarkable.

Bottle. Pretty clear brown with an off white head. Wheaty and toasty aroma with prunes, dried banana, raisins, cloves. 7+ Rich but not that sweet, reasonably high high carbonation keeps it cheerful when it could be heavy. Some orange and lemon along with pepper and cloves brightens things too. Quite spicy with dried fruit and toasty flavours underneath. Some bitterness as well as spices at the end. Maybe a bit clinical, but a pretty solid drop.

Pours attractive orange amber with fizzy beige head that lingers for a bit.
When they say harvest fruit, they mean the banana harvest, because thats the premier note of the aroma along with cloves, apples, raisins and alcohol.
Those are all there on the palate, along with honey, apricots and orange fizz. Alcoholic heat and a light body undercut the development, and the 8.7 percent ABV seems under-reported. But there are still a lot of flavors passing through, like a rum cake with sliced fruit.
You might find more nuance in Belgium or Germany, but this is a happy beer.

Poured to aggressively and ended with a three finger thick tan head over a bubbly glowing amber beer. Aroma is surprisingly similar to some Belgian dubbels with apricot and raisins, but it also has a yeasty barnyard aroma. Taste is of dark fruits, bread, hay, and earthiness. Palate is oily with lively fizziness.

Hazy deep Amber foamy Lacy beige head; aroma is malty sweet notes of honeydew melon; flava is malty grainy hints of hops and wood; feels medium thick with lively fizzy zing; finishes tangy dry mildly bitter yet hints of brown sugar

12 oz bottle- Pours dark orange to almost red with a large off white head that holds nicely. Aroma is malty, caramel malts, brown sugar, raisins, cherries. The taste is raisins, banana, caramel malts, kind of gritty,  the sweetness is in check. Not bad, nothing great either.

On tap @ Dorothy 6. Pours a deep orangish red with a thin white head. Faint smell of wheat and yeast but not too strong. Body is fairly thin but not watered down. Some wheat, yeast, and citrus flavors that are subtle and smooth. Not that great or special but enjoyable. Hides the alcohol well and tastes smoother than you might expect. Fairly refreshing.

12 oz bottle from Total Wine, then a case from work. Pours hazy amber with a medium bone-white head with good retention. Aroma is bananas, clove, wheat crackers, astringent alcohol. Taste is sweet and boozy, tasting a little like gingerbread or boozy rum cake; some apple character, as well. Somewhat foamy and thin mouthfeel. Its somewhat in the same ballpark as Bavarian examples, but its too boozy and thin to come close to the greats.
Dark amber with a tall pale yellow head. Aroma is a little wheaty, but mostly fruity. Taste is sweet, with a smooth and slightly spicy finish.

On tap. Cloudy orange/amber pour with large white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, caramel, cloves, banana and faint fruits. Taste of wheat, oranges, caramel, cloves, banana, bread dough and yeast. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, well balanced, slight alcohol burn. Only drawback was it became slightly cloying at the finish. Delicious beer!

Enjoyed from a growler purchased from Victory. Murky dark amber appearance. Banana, plum, cloves, cherries, and spices on the nose. Taste has a well-balanced sweetness with a mixture of flavors mirroring those aromas. Smooth full bodied mouth feel with moderate carbonation. Excellent weizenbock. Give it a try if you like the style.
Smells and tastes like banana bread and clove. One of my favorite fall beers. One of my favorite beers in general.

Pours hazy orange-amber with a 2-finger bone-colored head. Most prominent note in the complex aroma is of banana esters, with notes of apple and bread. Full-bodied and syrupy, with an astringent finish. Flavor of apple mixed with nutty malt up front, giving way to a banana note.

Very nice mouth feel w/ a Belgian complexity that makes this an excellent beer! Pours amber w/ a big foamy tan head that leaves lacing. The aroma is quite Belgian esque w/ banana & spices. Served on tap in a pint glass-
 Appearance  The brew is served a quite hazy copper-orange color with a billowy just off white colored head. The head has a great level of retention, slowly fading over time to leave almost no lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is rather strong of a nice wheat bread aroma, mixed with a good deal of fruits, being a mix of both dark and light varieties. The biggest fruit aromas are that of cherry, banana and plum Along with these aromas comes smells of yeast and spice with the spice being a blend of clove and coriander. A little bit of a grassier and caramel aroma are there as well giving it a rather smooth and sweet wheat bread smell.
 Taste  The taste begins with a good showing of wheat and fruity flavors with some plum and cherry and a little bit of a grainy taste. Right from the start there is a decent showing of a yeasty flavor with it also having taste of spice mixed within. Flavors of banana start out rather light upfront, but grow quite a bit stronger as the taste advances. More fruit flavors join the banana with a bit of a sour lemon and grassy taste joining the taste profile. The lemon actually gets moderately strong toward the end, but is ever balanced by spice flavors of clove and coriander as well as the darker fruit and wheaty flavors mixing with a decent sum of booziness to leave a sweet wheat and warming flavor on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel- The body of the beer is on the slightly chewier side with a carbonation level that is around average. For the mix of darker fruits, banana, spice and yeast with the decent boozy flavor, the feel is great as it provides a nice base for the flavors to be well supported and sensed, but yet has enough carbonation to keep it from any one component of the taste from becoming overwhelming.
 Overall  A fairly nice drinking brew. A decent level of booziness, but all very well balanced out by the wheat, fruit, and yeasty spiced flavors of the beer. Rather tasty.

12 ounce bottle into weizen glass, best before 8/19/2015. Pours hazy reddish copper color with a 2-3 finger dense and rocky light khaki head with incredible retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts the whole glass. Dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the dense head. Incredible appearance. Aromas of big banana, raisin, plum, cherry, clove, caramel, toast, toffee, brown bread, light nuttiness, herbal, pepper, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big banana, raisin, plum, cherry, clove, caramel, toast, toffee, brown bread, light nuttiness, herbal, pepper, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy yeast spice on the finish; with lingering notes of banana, raisin, plum, cherry, clove, caramel, toast, toffee, brown bread, herbal, pepper, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity and robustness of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt flavors; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible weizenbock! All around awesome complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt notes; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle from craft beer outlet. Pours an amber color with a nice creamy head. Some spices/fruit on the nose, and tastes of banana/caramel. Very good.

Draft at iron abbey. Gorgeous amber pour with haze and thick head. Aroma is rich dark fruits with no spice. Taste is sweet. Slight citrus presence is secondary to caramel flavors. Finishes very quick and clean. Hides the alcohol well. Really nice.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Weizen glass.

Aroma: Loads of bananas and cloves, with some sweet fruits and caramel. Alcohol becomes somewhat noticeable as well.

Taste: Tastes like a big Dunkelweizen upfront with banana and clove before a huge sweetness takes over incorporating plum, apple, cherry and toffee. Very light noble hops peek through at the end, and the cloves come back as well in full force.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, full almost chewy body that is slightly warming.

Overall: As my experience with Weizenbocks is limited, this really mostly seems like a cross between a Dunkelweizen and a Doppelbock. Complex but a little too sweet for mass consumption, otherwise very, very good.

Malty and somewhat sweet, but not overly so. Caramel, nuts, and a bit of spice as well.

Hazy orange pour with a small white head and floaties. Wheat and banana aroma. Wheat malt flavor, with a vinous component.

Bottle from Texas liquor: Poured as a cloudy and glowing tint of mahogany hue, and created a thick foamy head. Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12oz bottle into a Weizen glass. The label has a nice description and a freshness date. 

Appearance: Deep rich crimson highlights flow through a deep amber body with a slight haze. This is topped by a light beige colored and tightly packed head. The tall stiff foam hangs on well and makes lots of slick lacing on the glass. 

Smell: There are deep sweet fruity and bready notes with notes of wheat, banana bread with walnuts and over-ripe banana peel. 

Taste/Palate: The flavor matches the nose with a light dusting Dutch cocoa, fruity banana, dried apricots and a mild touch of hop spice. It also has a sweet and mellow abv warmth. The full body has a smooth creamy texture with plenty of soft carbonation. 

Notes: Outstanding!!!

In short: A weird, overly spicy and messy beer.  Bad batch?
How: Bottle 12oz.  Consumed fresh one month after purchase
The look: Cloudy dark amber topped by a quickly disappearing small beige head
In long: Nose of toasted wheat, banana bread and some cinnamon-like spices.   Taste is a bit musty, gingerbread man, doughy yeast, caramel, bubblegum, some raisin bread, some ripe bananas, apricots, some cloves, too much cinnamon, other stuff  Yes, there is a lot of things happening in this beer but it a bit of a mess.  Also the carbonation was too soft and the beer felt lifeless.  And this was a fresh bottle!  The beer was here, there and nowhere.  What is weird is I thought I liked that beer.  I drank a few of those some years ago and vaguely remember liking it.  But now that I decide to rate one (late 2010 batch) I find it is totally off.  Bad memory or bad batch?  The type of weizen bock with a bunch of stuff thrown at you that Id expect from a small amateurish brewery, not the usually clean and focussed Victory.  I have a lot of confidence in Victory so either I got a bad batch or I cant rate a beer.  Im not sure which one it is, but because of my optimistic nature I truly believe that Im half full of shit.
Im surprised to find this is 8.7% because its very smooth. The nose is of wheat and faint notes of cotton candy. Taste is very clean and effervescent. Very nice!

Bottle.  Pours hazy red and brown/orange with a medium orange and tan head.  The aroma is spicy Belgian yeast, candi sugar, slight clove, and some sour fruity notes.  The flavor is roasty malt, burnt caramel, yeast, spicy citrus, and some alcohol.  Medium carbonation and body.  Good.  [623]

Pours cloudy orange with an average sized white head. Aroma is of orange peels, wheat grass, and a bit of alcohol. Flavor is much stronger on the alcohol than the aroma gave away with a nice fruity backbone. Medium bodied and somewhat yeasty. Somewhat sharp taste upfront but smooth finish.

Pours a nice clear amber color with a very thin white head. Aroma of cloves, banana, yeast and some malts. Flavor is mostly spicy with hints of fruit and caramel.  Impressive complex beer.
Very fruity and spicy beer, almost overdoing it, takes away from the delicate lager sitting behind, a little more relaxed this would be a world class beer

beautiful color, pours dark redish gold. Dark fruit and malt aroma.  A little bitter and has a nice bite.  Overall very nice

tap at RnH - wheaty, cinnamon dark toffee malts. very aroumatic spices, savory herbs, tingly carbonation.

One of the most authentically German beers Ive ever had from an American brewery.  Very strong spiciness against a background of sweetbread and fruit notes, kind of like a spiced holiday desert.  The spices are a bit much for me to drink more than a half a bottle or so, but its got a very authentic yeasty characteristic that is quite impressive.  Not my favorite style, but well-executed.

A gorgeous opaque brown body sports a two finger beige froth that just wont quit. The aroma holds tons of dark fruit and spicy notes, starting with date, fig, plum, and raisin, immediately turning to clove, lavender, and lemon-citrus. A spicy bread dough comes near the finish to round out the yeast character. The flavor holds delicious bready caramel, molasses, and raisin-date with copious backnotes of clove and coriander. Doughy yeast and further proliferations of lemon come through as well, providing an excellent acidic balance to the sweet onslaught of dark sugars and dark fruit notes. The palate is rich, thick, and creamy with high levels of pillow like carbonation that allows for a clean, mildly acidic finish. A delicious example of the style, and just what the doctor ordered on a cold winter afternoon.

Session beer.

I like a spicy beer, but is it possible for a beer to be too spicy? Victory Moonglow Weizenbock makes a case for just that since its a beer thats literally bursting with so much flavor that its a challenge to drink. POUR, COLOR AND AROMAI have never had so much trouble pouring a beer as with Victory Moonglow. When my first bottle poured with an exuberant head I chalked this up to simple pourer error. But when the second bottle, intentionally poured carefully, produced an ever worse head I knew it wasnt me - it was the beer.Now, I like a big head on my beer but when the glass is more head than beer theres a problem. All that gas couldve been liquid! At least this beer has a pretty attractive copper-colored body which is mostly clear with a slight haze. The aroma was reminiscent of an authentic German hefeweizen or oktoberfestbier with a strong, spicy nose of clove and vanilla. TASTEUpon my first tasting of Victory Moonglow I had a weird feeling of déjà vu. Its as if I had just drunk this beer recently, and I have. Paulaners Hefeweizen and Erdingers Oktoberfest Hefeweizen immediately came to mind since this is a beer brewed in a similar style to those two. Whats interesting is that as much as this tastes like an authentic German brew, its actually the product of an American microbrewery (which imports malts and hops from Germany, according to their website).Moonglow has a very strong, spicy palate with banana, clove and vanilla being the most noticeable ingredients. Because this is such as strongly-flavored beer its initially difficult to distinguish between the three, since the overall taste is a spicy bite on your tongue. In fact, the beer has something of a dry taste and finish because its so strongly-flavored.FINISHI like a beer with some bite, but not to the point where its difficult to drink. Ive had much harsher beers than Victory Moonglow, but for a craft beer in the unfiltered wheat beer style, its surprisingly coarse. It finishes much drier than it starts out and leaves a dry, cough syrup-like aftertaste in my mouth. BODYNeither the box nor the bottle itself indicated the potency to Victory Moonglow, but I had a feeling it was higher than normal about halfway through my first bottle when I felt very inundated. Once I visited the brewers website and learned it was 8.7% ABV I realized there was a reason I felt so weighed-down. Why this beer is brewed with such a high potency without using the Imperial sub-title is a bit of a mystery. That helps explain why Victory Moonglow is such a seemingly heavy brew. I had one after dinner and chalked up my feeling bloated to drinking it too close to a meal. But after waiting a significant time to start on my second, I was surprised I felt as equally full as the first.FINAL THOUGHTSDespite all my criticisms of Victory Moonglow Weizenbock, I have to admit its a very tasty beer and I did enjoy drinking it at the time. Its very rare I encounter a beer that is so strongly flavored it actually puts me off, but I would gladly take a beer of this type over a watered-down mass-market lager any day. Its very rare to find an American microbrew come so close to its original German style, so at the very least its worth trying once.
