Flavor of caramel, cloves, wheat bread, brown sugar, toffee, hay, and cinnamon sticks.  Finishes, with a slightly dry interpretation of the malt flavors without changing things too much.  A little toasty and grassy, slightly earthy, but similar to the flavor.  Medium to full bodied, creamy, fluffy texture and high carbonation.  Quite a winner in my book!  Probably too sweet for some , but its very good.  And like others said, the aroma IS better than the flavor.

12 oz. bottle. Spicy, tangy, salty, and creamy aroma features cinnamon, coriander, thyme, and orange scents. Interesting, unique, and appealing smell. Pours a hazy, bright, copper color with a large amount of small, fast-rising bubbles, and a large amount of uneven, beige head. Buttery, yeasty taste features sweet cream, vegetable (especially celery), and apple flavors. Spicy, dry finish. As is the case with many other wheat beers, the aroma exceeds the flavor in its appeal; a little dull. Strange aftertaste for which I dont much care. Medium body. Milky, smooth, and silky in the palate. Reasonably lively, though not astoundingly so. This is a classic German-style wheat beer in that it starts out so promising in the nose and appearance but ends in disappointment.

Copper pour with a thin fast fading cap.
aroma is honey and caramel malt sweetness. some banana and pear like fruity tones. a spicy yeastiness.
Flavour is bold up front  wheat malt, banana and spice, some caramel and toasted malt tones, a spicy medicinal hoppiness in the finish.

12 oz bottle.  Color, murky copper, and head, quickly dissapating cream colored, are both great.  The amount of chunks of yeast suspended in this bad boy is not.  Nose is banana and clove and yeasty.  Light brown sugar hints peek out as well.  Taste is big clove and citrus sweetness.  Lots of Belgian influence here.  Taste is big and full and sweet.  Too much for my enjoyment.  Just not my fave style of beer.

12 oz bottle. Pours a thick, lasting head, with some lacing, over a slightly cloudy, amber (SRM 10) body, which has some flocculated yeast......nose is light bubblegum/banana, bit of clove, bit of dried cherry, slight caramel/toffee....taste is dominated early by sweet malts, with toffee/caramel, later dried fruit tones including cherry and raisin, finishing with strong clove layers, alcohol is well hidden....mouth feel is medium, as is carbonation.  When tasting, let this warm up a bit, the full richness and depth of texture then come out. A nice Weizen Bock, with many of the usual  features. BJCP 9/3/14/4/7

Bottle; poured an orange-amber color with a light khaki head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, fruit, yeast with a good amount of sweetness.  Flavor was not quite as sweet; would have liked a touch more.  Banana and fruit, with some earthiness in the finish.  A solid beer.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a nice cloudy dark amber with off-white head.  Lots of big chunks of yeast floating around, nicely carbonated, and nice lacing.  Flavor is dark wheat malt, clove, and molasses.  I like the darker weizenbock less, but still pretty good.

A tan head jumps up from the body and continues to grow even after pouring has stopped.  It very slowly fades.  That body is dark brown and opaque with a good amount of carbonation.  Nose is molasses and clove.  Chocolate flavors, alcohol, dark bread, citrus fruit, yeast.  Finish is a bit bland.  Nice and flavorful and the alcohol was pleasant on a freezing January evening.

Bottle from K&L Redwood City.  Pours a cloudy amber-brown color with a large off-white head that lasts a long time.  I know this is unfiltered, but there were a lot of chunks o crap floating in the beer, which I found a bit disconcerting.  Aroma is yeasty banana and clove, sweet malt, and dark fruits.  Flavor is nice but not as great as I expected.  Cherry, plum, banana, and fig, along with caramel malt and some spiced notes.  Medium bodied and just a tad boozy, with fairly lively carbonation.  Overall this is a solid weizenbock, but didnt really impress me.

Found this one bottled at Binnys in St. Charles, Illinois.  Cloudy dark orange pour with a thick, foamy light orange head, a nice citrusy nose.  Flavor was a sickly combination of banana and vegetables. Didnt really care for this.
Hazy dark orange color/ fleeting head. Mild yeasty sweetbread molasses aromas. medium body. Lightly tart dark wheat flavor with sweet Hawaiian bread yeastyness. not too bad.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Pours a copper color with a off white tan head with nice lacing.  aroama is yeasty with bread, banana, fruit, and some carmel coming through.  flavor is of wheat, banana, carmel, yeast, apricot, plum, and a little bubblegum.  has a medium-full body with nice carbonation.  overall, I enjoyed this one very much.

Pours a slight cloudy dark copper with a slightly off white head. Aroma is sweet of plum, fig, spice, banana, and some cherry.  Flavor is fig, light cherry, spice, light raisin, and plum. Slightly sour, sweet, and bitter all in one.  I could drink many of these all night. Interesting little mix of bock meets wheat beer. Very nice indeed.

Bottle from Stan at Lone Hill.  Smells like an imperial US wheat ale - nothing particularly German in the nose.  Color is a light brown.  Flavor is wheat, flower, maybe some caramel malt, but doesnt have that heady, sugary weizenbock sweetness.  Decent.

Pours a coudy dark orange/amber color with golden orange hues when held to a light source and a massive frothy off white head that very slowly fades into a lasting cap.

Yeasty aroma with lots of bread, sweet caramel/chocolate, ripe banana citrus peel and spicy clove.

Heavily carbonated up front with a lot of zest clove spice followed by a full yeasty/bready body with plenty of ripe banan and citrus pell and a tart dry finish. Clove is prominent but the darker caramel/choclate malt notes as well as the citrus and banana notes balance things out very nicely. The slight tart finish is what really separates this beer and makes it very flavorful. It lingers after the end of each sip and leaves me salivating for more. I have to stop myself from pounding this so I can fully enjoy it.

pours out dark honey gold with a tall bubbly beige head.  the body is a cloudy amber with a good amount of bubbles rising in the center of the glass.  the aromas are spicy and fruity.  there is some yeast also present, but is really pungent with fruits and some lightly roasted malts.  it is light bodied and a little over carbonated on the tongue.  it is a little sweet and "wheaty", like some sugar coated grain cereal.  it is also a little malty and some alcohol is present.  theres some bitterness, but not from the hops.  there is also some fruits present on the tongue.  the aftertaste is not really that good and leaves a weird taste in the back of my mouth.  finishes a little watery and quite refreshing.

This one smells (and looks) like something from Hair of the Dog - lovely. Lots of malt, caramel and very ripe fruit. Not nearly as thick as something like Doggie Claws, but it has a similar flavor - just a bit more hops, and thinner / more effervescent. Aroma is wonderful, but the flavor leaves something to be desired. Its a decent bock, and with some of the carbonation swirled out its actually really nice. Certainly glad I tried it.

12oz bottle.   Hazy dark orange with a medium off-white head.   The aroma displays a lot of weizen yeast character, with lots of clove and banana.   The flavor also has plenty of banana, clove to a lesser extent and a caramel-sweet malt flavor.   Medium bodied with higher carbonation.   Sweet and yeast overall.   OK, but just not quite all there compared to some of the better ones.

Pours dark orange with a frothy off-white head. Aroma is yeasty with vanilla and bananas, sort of smoothie-like. Flavor is similar with wheat bread, bananas, cloves, caramel, and a slight bitterness. Carbonation is high, mouthfeel is soft and smooth. Very drinkable for the abv, you wouldnt know it was almost 9%.

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy light amber with a nice creamy head.   Aroma of banana and clove with a bit more malty sweetness present.  Flavor was a bit more tart than expected with tastes of banana, clove and tart apple fruitiness blended into a caramel malty character.  Full bodied with a full and thick mouthfeel.

330 ML Bottle in the USA. Deep ruby/brown color, hazy, with a tan head. Yeasty and fruity aroma. The full flavor was of fruit, yeast, malt, and spice. Nice body. A good WB but lacking a bit from the German types of this style.

12 oz bottle courtesy of the Binnys singles rack (Orland Park, IL). Pours a nice dark full amber, well hazed, some reddish orange glowing notes, a huge tannish head that bubbles well and cakes, laces ok, eventually dies to a moderate head. Aromas are fruity banana esters, a touch of apple, cinnamon, flaked white wheat, a touch of citrusy lemon, followed up by more caramelized maltiness underneath, a touch of brown sugar and breadiness. Initial is reminiscent of banana bread, assertive fruity banana esters, brown sugar, bread, a touch of sweet cakiness, vanilla. This backs a decent alcohol punch on the backend, warming as it travels down. Further in more wheat comes in, grainy, bready, sweet, with a light bitterness. In my opinion, the alcohol gets in the way on the backend, almost causing heartburn for me it is so out of place. A nice darker wheat beer would have been nice, but this takes it a little too far for me. The flavors are well in place, but the alcohol is distracting for me, detracting from the overall balance and experience. A decent enough beer with some overall flaws.

12oz bottle from Orland Park Binnys single rack. Pours hazy orangish amber with massive off-white head. Aroma is banana, clove, lemon, bready malts, yeast, spices and some tartness. Flavor is sweet caramel and brown sugar with banana, clove, bready malts, and some spices. Mouthfeel is a tad thin even though the malts are a little chewy. Flavor is much lighter than I anticipated based on the aroma. Overall this is a pretty flavorful weizen bock.
Bottle. Pours with a huge, foamy off-white head and a hazy brown body. Aroma of banana, toffee, vanilla, clove. Taste, apples, toffee, brown sugar, clove, orange juice.Full bodied, medium carb.
12 oz bottle.  Pours copper in colour, with red tinge.  Balanced, somewhat sweet malt, but floral hop finish.  Nice!

16 ounce pint - $6.50 at Taco Mac in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Descends from the top-level tap a mid-range mahogany-hued body topped with a finger of off-white foam.

Smell: Tangy, spiced bouquet of bready dark malted wheat and supporting clove and peeled banana notes, as well as sweet-scented hints of caramel and golden syrup.

Taste: Ah, the tanginess of German wheat malt with a taste of toasted bread smothered in gooey, sweet caramel sauce. Mingled amidst the malty tastes are some spicy phenols providing a mild, easy-going cracked clove flavor. Also, some fruity touches of raisins and bananas to be found in there. Hint of sourish yeast. Lightly spicy, herbal hop character with a mild, restrained level of bitterness. Finishes tangy and malty and pretty crisp, I must say.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium-high carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel.

Drinkability: An agreeable Fall seasonal that isnt just another Pumpkin Ale or Oktoberfest. Although the alcohol isnt overly evident in the taste, it sure did sneak up on me later, providing me with quite a glow of my own.

12 oz bottle, Belgian snifter glass. Pours a picturesque ruddy amber with offwhite creamy head, nose is winter spices, wheaty fruitiness, sweet treacle and lemongrass. Bubblegum, light banana on the palate, which is somewhat thin but well carbonated. Quite warming towards the finish, alcohol is quite present on the tongue, along with faint medicinal bitterness. Quite indicative of the style, just not something one could drink much of. Perhaps aging some a bit might smooth the rough edges.

Wonderfully delicious, rich and full, but doesnt sit heavy on the stomach. Theres a head-swmming combination of citrus, banana, bubblegum, spice, chocolate, and wheat. The alcohol is hidden--but felt! Definitely a favorite.

A bit thin on the palate.  Brown with low carbonation.  The flavor and aroma is right, wheat, some bubblegum, banana, and fairly sweet.   I can feel the alcohol.  I have wanted to try this for years.  A good beer.

Had this on tap at Tylers and then bought a 6 pack because I liked it so much.  Aroma is deep, fruity, citrus, and wheat bock smell with hints of fall (if you can consider that a smell).  Just absolutely delicious.  Its rich and full of flavor, but isnt too heavy considering the alcohol percentage.  The full bodied wheat beer has drawn my attention recently, and this one stands out.  I love many of the Victory beers, and this is definitely one of them.  Cheers

Bottle. 12 oz. Pours cloudy tan, with a smooth, creamy beige head. Aroma of wheat, apples, hay, lemon, and dry hops. Medium bodied with a nice, bubbly mouthfeel. Finish is tart and crisp. Very good weizen bock from Victory.

Amber-bronze color with steady and tight carbonation, a 3/4" light tan head and great lacing. Musty dank fruit aromas with clove and banana coupled by a yeast and wheat scent. Medium bodied, sweet and gritty with a touch of heat. Malty, sugary rolls with maple and spicy wheat. Dry aftertaste. Fermented plums and raisins with bananas.

murky orange body with perched perfect head. nose is soft weizen banana with a dark element of nuts and carmelization. flavor is most importantly of hidden booze, subtle touch of dubbel like stone fruits along with banana and black pepper. super soft mouthfeel loaded with silk. awesome example of the style and deadly sessionable.

Spicy berry and orange aroma. Belgian ale funk with a flowery, estery hop. A dry, peppery wheat base. Tangerine and mango as it warms up. Perfume.

Pours a beautiful cloudy blush red. Tons of carbonation floating upward. Sediment cascading down. Nice puffy head.

Fruity berry flavor in the first sip, followed by that peppery wheat. Some grape and plum. The dark fruits come through and really enhance this one. Tart funk at the end.

The palate is fizzy and creamy. Milky, especially when it warms up. Overall, its dark frutisy with a mild spicy funk. A damn fine, delicious Weizenbock.

Pours hazy orange with lots of head which is retained.  Lots of lacing.  Excellent aroma of sweet caramel covered bananas.  Aroma and appearance are near perfect.  Good malt and banana flavor.  Nice medium body.  Overall an excellent Weizen Bock and another great brew from Victory.
On tap from Lucky Baldwins pub in Pasadena, Calif. Very clear with malt and caramel flavors. My wife loves this beer, she had two and that is rare. Spicey, sweet with a good and chewy aftertaste.

12oz bottle pours a dark orange with a foamy white head.  Aroma of fruit, spices, malt and sugar.  Taste is citrusy(mostly grapefruit), malty and sweet with some cherry and spice - alcohol warms as this beer finishes.  Solid brew.
On tap at Slows Bar-B-Q.  Pours brown with an off-white head.  Aroma of light fruit and cloves.  Flavor is cloves and bubblegum with caramel notes and wheat.  Overall pretty enjoyable.

Not much of a wheat beer fan, but Ive do seem to enjoy bocks (and Victory) so I gave this one a go. It has a fleeting white head and pours a dark, hazy orange. Smells of orange, lemon, and brown sugar. Strong orange flavor, very sweet, kind of like those chocolate covered orange sticks. No bitterness really of note. Finishes kind of like a lemon. Not bad for wheat.
Bottle, via trade with beachbum25, thick golden orange colored pour with ripe tropical fruit aromas, flavor has lots of grape, plum, caramel and raisins, good lasting finish

12 oz bottle.  Pours deep copper with lasting cream colored head.  Aroma is spicy apples, plums, and raisins with a touch of yeast, very sweet.  Flavor starts very fruity and alcoholic, same raisins and plums with atouch of spicy nutmeg, finishes with sweet maltiness and lingers bitterly.  Medium body, definitely warms as it goes down.  Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2010 I enjoyed this one at our annual pumpkin carving ritual at Casa Gardler - a great time as usual.  Rich fruity aroma - apples, cherries, with hints of resins, spices and dark malt, and a slight hint of banana.  Flavor is fruity and complex, and the alcohol is evident.  Another great beer from Victory but it definitely packs a punch - a serious punch.

This beer is a mouthful. A large amount of spices and malts. It has a pretty high alcholic taste and finish. Tasted slightly mettallic but i think that was the booze. Very good winter beer, will warm you up.

Pours very nice and thick beige head with a cloudy light muddy brown body. Tons of things to smell in this beer: caramel, banana, citrus, and spice. Beer itself gave you a warm feel when drank. Very nice mouthfeel. Some sweetness. Wheat beer taste underlies the whole beer, but a lot more is loaded on top of that basic schematic. Alcohol well-contained, but at the same time noticeable in a good way. Tons of spice and mild hoppage.

Pours a hazy brown/amber with a 1-finger thick head.  Has very nice lacing.  Smells like wet straw, wheat, banana, and leather yet somehow inviting.  The taste is strong spice and malt.  There is some clove, caramel, and banana in there as well.  The spice really lingers in the back of your throat.  Mouthfeel is very much like a Bock and it has a slight alcohol warmth.  This is actually a very well crafted beer.

sample from the bottle at The 2009 Great Decatur Beer Festival on 10/17/09... pours a murky brown/orange color... slight caramel malt aroma... medium body with some banana and light spice... wheat finish.  not bad....

Pours a dusky, semi-transparent brownish copper. Head was thin, but that was probably an artifact of how it was poured. Spicy, wheaty, slightly yeasty aroma is appealing. Wheaty and spicy flavor has hints of caramel. Texture is lively and tingly, making this pleasant to drink.

Murky amber with an off white with the carbonation allowing the head to linger. On nose Im going to say its the spice cabinet combined with Juicy Fruit. Light medium on body with a warming mouthfeel. The finish is short and slightly biter.

12oz bottle. Gorgeously murky pour. Very nice, airy white head that lasts a while. Aroma of fruit esters and bubble gum.  Really smooth going down, then the flavor of clover and bananas become dominant rear their heads. Carbonation becomes obvious once you swallow the beer. Slight alcohol in the aftertaste. I like the slight tingle at the end compared to some of the creaminess of other beers in the genre. One of my new favorite weizen bocks

Pours a beautiful, dark amber with a big, creamy, tan head.  THe nose is all bananas, cloves and white pepper.  Just underneath is that nice earthy grain.  Banana is the dominant taste, with the cloves and a nice creamy mouth feel.  A little bit of Bananas Foster, in a good way.

12oz bottle.  Deep amber color.  Thick pour.  White head of cream.  Huge aroma of fruity esters.  Huge ripened banana.  Lots of sugars in the nose as well as a hint of clove.  spicy pepper mouthfeel.  Very smooth texture.  A bit too carbonated.  Lots of clove flavor.  Sweet malted wheat.  Cream of wheat hot cereal with over ripened slices of bananas on top.  Very strong.  Heavier bodied than what was expected.

cloudy reddish brown under a large creamy, off-white head.  sweet carmelly, banana aroma.  strong aromatic beer.  flavor was less exciting with spicy yeast, hint of banana, caramel and a bit of heat from the alcohol.  medium body.  not as creamy as i like.   ive had better.
Bottle. Poured a deep red/orange body with nice head. Aroma of cloves, banana and spices. Nice flavorful taste, medium body and smooth.

6 pack of 12 oz.s just purchased from Macs on West Peachtree. Alright, I am happy to finally see this. Dark brown with a head that fades way quickly. Nice translucent dark brown color that just makes me want to down this thing right now. Aroma is spicy banana with yeast. Lots of spice coming off of this thing. Fairly pungent. Hint of clove seals the deal. Honestly, this is a damn good aroma. Slight alcohol presence in the flavor. The spice and banana with yeast follow through well. Not as creamy as I thought it would be; there is this bite of carbonation that kinds of annoys me. Overall, damn nice weizen with a lot of spice banana and yeast to make you smile.

Pours a hazy amber color with a massive off-white head.  Sweet and spicy aroma, lots of banana and cloves.  Relatively light bodied and easy drinking, malty brew finishes with a menthol dryness.  Nutmeg and cinnamon shine through here... great, easy drinking autumn beer.

Appearance is a red/brown with a respectable head that turns into a crown with decent lacing. 

Scent is piney, with banana and orange peel also rearing their head. 

Taste is sneaky; almost watery at first then a nice balanced hop flavor comes in at the end. 

Mouthfeel is adequate. Medium carbonation and body. 

Drinkability is good, its a good smooth beer that goes down easy. I will order again.

Bottle from Archer Liquor. Pours amber with a 4-finger frothy beige/tan head. Aromas of date-like fruit and spice/yeast. Medium body with frothy carbonation. Flavor is sweetish, sticking with date, spicey. Has a pretty fair amount of bitter to offset the malt. Good weizen bock. Althought the weizen isnt all that noticeable.

Bottle. Pours a slightly amber body with a huge frothy biege head, which left a thin ring throughout.Great fruity, spicy and bananna aroma. Very similar carbonated body with a nice spicy aftertaste. Really nice bitter hoppy finish. Really getting to start liking this style. Another great beer from Victory Brewing.

Big thanks to Zathrus13 for throwing this one in as an extra many moons ago.

I could barely get this one to the glass as the foam gushed out the top.  It pours is a cloudy brown with orange hints, kinda like a cloudy tea, with a huge off-white head that leaves generous lacing and sticks around for the duration.  Tons of big chunks floating around that end up gathering together at the bottom of the glass.

The aroma is excellent and dominated by the sweet bananas, other over-ripe sweet fruits and plenty of caramel and vanilla.  The spices werent too noticeable in the nose for me - maybe some light pepper notes.

The taste isnt quite as impressive but still pretty damn good.  The initial taste is of some lighter apples and pears and the taste has lest banana-like flavors than I was expecting from the nose.  The yeast and caramel malt form a big backbone with the spices finally showing up in the finish, mostly pepper and maybe some cloves.

The mouthfeel doesnt seem quite full enough to carry the complexity of the flavors.  Its got tons of carbonation, maybe too much, and the body comes across as a little watery.

Despite the slight ding on mouthfeel, this is an excellent weizenbock - one of the best Ive had.  The aroma is world class for me and a bit thicker mouthfeel might have this one in the same league as Aventinus.  As it is, its a notch below which aint too shabby.

Thanks must be given once more to my older sister who lives up in the northeast, Delaware to be exact, where the Victory flows freely and bottles are just one liquor store away. Heck, they may even be in some grocery stores, but I can only speculate. They brew one of the best traditional pilsners this side of Plzen, Czech; Victory Prima Pils. Today though, I am delighted to try another offering, the Moonglow Weizenbock. I am a huge fan of weizen bocks, so it would seem that the stars are shining in my favor today. Now, this is a weizen bock versus a weizen doppelbock, so while I expect a lot of the traditional aromas and flavors, they should lack some of the intensity of their bigger brothers.


Cloudy burnt maple syrup with a scattering of suspended chunks. A huge khaki hat adorns her body, though she does deflate into a more subtle blanket after being allowed to rest for a few minutes. No amount of foam though could hold back her impatient nose which is scrambling to appease my critical senses. Rich bananas and banana bread of the darker variety, pumpernickel and rye, with an interesting follow-up addition of whoppers, aka malt balls. Brown sugar and cinnamon sticks offer the perfect spice accompaniment while she shows a fruitier side with soft, suckling notes of peaches, mango, and plantains. Her finish is a warming rush of rum, wood, vanilla, and oak while more bananas come out to play. Very supple indeed, my first quaff is as satisfying as her nose promised. Ripe, soft bananas and banana bread drizzled with maple syrup while cinnamon sticks and candied pecans accompany her on the side. Her dry spices like to rest squarely on top of my tongue while rum, raisins, and prunes go for the finish. Her palate is a bit dryer than I was expecting, making for a very clean quaff each time that is only highlighted by the addition of wood notes and vanilla bean. Her fruitier side is much more subdued in the palate, showing up every now and then as a whisper of an undercurrent. Overall, her flavor points are spot on, and she isnt too heavy, otherwise then she would be bordering on a doppelbock. As my final quaff lingers with spice, wood, maple, and banana bread dotted with pecans, I am left with two conclusions. In terms of style, she is expertly executed. In terms of personal taste, I think I enjoy the heartier, more complex weizen doppelbocks better.


The Moonglow Weizenbock from Victory Brewing was good, not great but good. Definitely a more sessionable brew then her bigger brothers. If you are looking for all the flavor without the extra added weight and complexity, then the Moonglow is all you need to bring a smile to your lips and a happy gurgle to your belly.

11/08/2007:  Victory Moonglow Weizen Bock looks thick!  It is a cloudy caramel/golden orange color with a big, foamy ivory-colored head that has a reserve cascading effect after the initial pour and then lasts for the entire session.  It also creates thick foamy lacing throughout.  There is active carbonation, but due to the medium-full body of this beer, it still feels slightly chewy in the mouth.  Strong banana, caramelized malts, and clove spice are present in the aroma.  The strong flavor has  caramel malts, wheat, and some alcohol that cuts through at times.  This is a very good weizen bock!
12 fl. oz. bottle (Enjoy by: Aug 29 08) shared by.  Rating # for this beer.
This is my second beer from Victory. I was amazed by this beer as well. Great flavor! Kind of sweet but with a afterbite. The alcohol is well hidden for the amount.
Dark really cloudy pour. A bit thick. Aroma is some spice and caramel and brown sugar sweetness. Flavor is pretty good. Heavy body and rich spices. A bit too much for me on the spice.

Thanks ogglethorp. Pours a murky orange with a large off-white head.  My glass has a bit of trouble containing it.  Nice lace.  Aroma has clove followed by caramel, quickly fading.  Flavor initially erupts in a really nice clove-alcohol-orange burst, the back end is less pleasant, a bit cloying, and the wheat gets husky.  Warm and effervescent on the palate. Medium to full bodied.

Pours a very cloudy orange with a thick foam head. Aroma is very fruity, much more on the dark fruit (plums) along with apples and oranges, than the bananas of a lighter weizen, with the usual spicy aromas of a good German hefe as well. Flavor starts out sweet, on plums again, then turns brighter and a bit citrusy. Palate is overcarbonated, bordering on harsh; it really detracts from the flavor. However, this is still a very nice brew, and one that I would drink a lot of if I could get it locally.
Finally rating this.... great head..fruity spicy aroma and taste...hints of citrus with a nice warming effect... Very nice beer from Victory

well lets just say i thought this was good  .  I mean it had spice and flavor.  It did not hold back on that shit.  It was a good winter beer, althought it had that crappy aftertaste that accompanies many lager imo.
Bottle. Pours cloudy amber, small head. The usual banana fruit nose for a hef. Sweet malt with a caramelized pear flavor and a nice warmth.

12 oz bottle. Pours a red/amber color with an off white creamy head. Aroma is banana, wheat grain, and clove spice. Substantial mouth feel with moderate carbonation tickling the tongue. Flavor is banana and slight peach, wheat and clove spice. Enjoyable weizenbock, although lighter than some.

Closest thing to Aventinus you can get in a six pack. Similar, but a bit lighter and smoother. Not necessarily a good or bad aspect. Kinda miss the bite of aventinus, but the slightly higher abv is appreciated.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Very fruity nose with nice musty wheat in there.  Flavor is just as nice.  Pretty nice weizen bock.  Dug it.

Hazy orange pour with a light yellow-tan head. Very nice smell with all sorts of fruits (peach, lemon), a bunch of wheat and yeast. Nice bananaish flavor with some peach, lemon, wheat, clove and I detect some coriander as well. Very flavorful and tasty brew, another winner from Victory.

Enjoyed via 12oz bottle.  Dark tan in appearance.  Aroma is fruity, not unlike a traditional Bavarian Weizen, but with a nice malt note.  Flavor is full on the palate; fruity and sweet, without being cloying.  Overall, an enjoyable experience.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2010 Pours a very hazy, muddy, orangey, copper color with a moderately full, yellowish-beige, creamy, fluffy head which is fairly lasting and leaves tight, foamy lace.  Nose is great, one of the best wheats Ive smelled; lots of estery yeast with bananas and peach notes, clove dominating, undertones of spices (nutmeg, coriander, allspice), some orange zest, maybe even some faint floral and brown sugar.  Flavor is dominated by the banana yeast esters, but underneath lies, cloves, peach skins, faint orange zest, faint nutmeg and coriander, and light sweet wheat breads.  Palate is perfect for the style; more than medium, lightly chewy, round, and nearly lively.  Somewhat refreshing but still sweet and just glimpses of dryness.  Finishes fairly long with clove, light wheat, and lingering bananas and orange zest.  One of the better examples of the style retaining refreshing qualities to match complexities and malt notes.  Not Schneider Aventinus, but certainly better than most and the ABV was unnoticable.

Bottle.   Pours a dark amber color with a decent sized tan head.   Aroma is malt, yeast, light fruit, alcohol.   Flavor is light banana, caramel, alcohol, bitter hops, spice.   Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, finished on the sweet side.   Solid, though not great.

Bottle. Rich deep copper and clear with lots of rising bubbles. Yeasty esters, aromatically fruity and major banana. Oily mouthfeel, low carbonation. Lingering yeasty sweetness. A lovely, fun fruity and unique beer that shares my nickname!
amber with lots of head and lacing. big time carbonation. aroma is wheat and perhaps honey with a faint raspberry kick. taste is slightly sugary and to match the aroma. palate is full and nice.

12oz bottle poured into a weizen glass. This is very nice looking dark orange, decent rocky head, looks great. Smells very fruity, spicy and malty. Taste is nice fruit and malt, surprisingly good stuff. This is one of the better beers that I have had from Victory.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-26-2008 22:14:34

nice hazy deep caramel color with a thick foamy light tan head.  aroma is lightly spicy...clove... with a hint of banana but too much alcohol in the aroma.  flavor used to be so much better but this is over hopped for the style, under spicy, and muddled.  something in the flavor reminds me of fish.  mouthfeel is a bit thin and the fishy flavor lingers in the aftertaste.  what happened to the moonglow that i had years ago?

12oz Bottle  99 Bottles  Federal Way, WA 
Huge what aroma and flavor with grapefruit and banana esters.  Nice color and finish this was a decent beer I was not impressed with the finish as it was a tad tart.

A pleroma of flavors leap out everywhere in this drink.  Sweet tropical fruit notes with various spices and other sweet fruits components.  Chewy caramel malt backbone with great spicy yeast character.

Pours reddish amber with a fizzy tan head.  The aroma has thick candied bananas, spice, brown sugar, toffee, caramel, cloves and chewy wheat.  Medium / thick body with an over-abundance of carbonation.  The flavor starts with much of whats on the aroma with some medicinal sour traits.  The finish is quite spice and gets more dry.  A good beer, but not at the top of the style.

Draft:  Poured an orange color with not much head.  The aroma was dark fruits and malts.  The flavor was raisins, grapes, sugar, and sweet malts.  Overall, an excellent beer that I cant wait for next year to get more.

12 oz bottle from a 6pack from EZ Liquors. Pours a solid brown orange with an average size foamy beige head that leaves less traces then a mafia money launderer. Aroma is all sweetness with notes of raisin, toffee, caramel, sugar, plastic modeling glue, vinous grapes. Palate is very full from the foaminess of the beer as it hits your mouth with a suprrisingly averge finish that is neither dry nor sweet. Add in some lively carbonation and this is one rather full bodied beer.  Flavor starts off with some initial sweetness, raisin, dark fruit juice,..but then the wheat body kicks in with some grassy and wheaty notes finsihed off with uncooked brown bread, and some raw rum raisin bread dough. Average to slightly above but this isnt knoicking down my doors like some other PA beers.
Bottle.  Pours hazy amber with a rocky head.  Lots of dry fruit aroma and nice spice character.  I dont find banana in here.  A little sweeter than I like but very tasty.

12 oz. bottle, Pours a dark cloudy amber with a quickly fading head. Aroma is spicy with cloves. Taste has strong notes of caramel, citrus and dark fruits, wheat along with belgian brew spices and yeast. Pretty complex, VERY sweet, not much bitterness. Alcohol content very well hidden. Mouthfeel is full and round. Quality brew.

Pours redish amber with three fingers of head.  Tons of aroma right off the bat. Lots of fruit: banana, apple, pear, and cherry. Definite yeast and a little alcohol as it warms.  Soft palate. Flavor is fruity and sugar sweetness with a hint of spice. Alcohol is apparent as it warms, but is generally well hidden. This is a solid brew.

Cloudy orange/brown with  large light tan, foamy head and a fine, spotted lace. Aroma of caramel, complimented by a light fruitiness, and with a hint of cloves. Medium body, lively carbonation, smooth with a rich velvety palate. Thick malty sweetness up front, but balanced well with some mild acidity, and a bit of tanginess. The finish is softly sweet, with a subdued hop bitterness. Pretty nice weizenbock, drinkable, and satisfying.
Sweet malty aroma with some yeasty wheat.  Typical looking dark wheat, warm malty sweetness on the tongue.  Finishes with cotton candy and a foamy smooth palate.

Poured a very lightly hazy copper color with a light tan head. There was a good amount of carbonation bubbles rising in the glass. The beer looked very nice in the glass after the pour. The head went down fairly soon, but did leave a bit of lacing. The aroma was good with scents of caramel and spices. The initial taste was tart and crisp with lots of carbonation. It was slightly dry with a crisp tart flavor of apples, then rolled into a mild sweetness under the crispness and ended with a very mild bite and the sense of fall spices. Enjoyable beer.

Had to smuggle this back from NC after realizing it was not going to make it to GA this year.  A little more of a clear brown color. Aromas and flavors dominated by some caramel sweetness, purple fruit like plum, and a faint bitter finish.  Decent body and developed malt profile. Really enjoyed this one.

Tap @ Standings Bar, doing this as an end of the year rate-a-thon.  I do not think I have actually tried this before.  It pours an oily brown color, if a color can have a slick or oily texture, this would be it. Aroma is strong, a bit overly spiky esters of banana with brown sugar. Its a bit too aggressive and out of control.  In the flavor the esters are much more controlled and has a light fruity aspect and some sweet banana bread.  Overall, it came off too much as an industrial weizen bock, a bit too filtered of a feel on the palate and no richness to it.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: A bit of a hazy reddish/brown pour.  Frothy off white head.  Aroma of yeast, spices, banana and some citrus.  Flavor is spicy, creamy, malty with hints of citrus and pumpkin pie spices.  Very well crafted beer.

[Bottle] Pours a cloudy copper color with a large, dense white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, spices and light wheat malt. Taste is rather spicy... with citrus,  nutmeg and maybe some cinnamon or clove. It also tastes like generous amounts of wheat malt was used, which made for a great palate. Alcohol is well hidden. A very good beer.

Bottle.  Pours a mahogany body with a 3 finger off white head.  Fruity nose with coriander and banana.  A light spicy pepper with clove and cinnamon.  Fruity esters dominate the flavor with a tangy spiciness to finish.  Good brew.

NIce deep beautiful pour.  One of my favorite styles so I am esy to please.  Head aroma, clove banana spice and a mix of americanized hop twang to balance.  Balanced, sparkling mouth quality with a varied spectrum of flavors.  Focus is mainly drawn towards the clovy vanilla banana flavor, but there are also hidden and more complex flavors of fruit, spice and citrus woven into the texture of the brew.  Overall very nice!

bottle from OSLO.  Pours light brown with an off white head and plenty of particles floating around.  Standard weizenbock aromas of banana, clove, light bubblegum, a hint of alcohol, cinnamon, tart wheat and apple skin.  As this warms, a slightly musty note appears which seems a little off.  The yeast pour produces a unique sharpness to the nose.  The taste is very good with banana, vanilla, a spike of tart wheat right before the finish which settles to an excellent caramel or toffee flavor at the end which lingers nicely.  The carbonation was crisp, and the mouthfeel was medium.  A solid weizenbock indeed.  Thanks Al!

Bottle.  Pours a dark amber color with a very large, frothy head.  Lacing is excellent.  Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, and a bit of clove.  Lively texture with a creamy start, slick finish.  Taste of bananas, roasted malts, and a bit of grapefruit.  Complex beer and very good.

Bottle courtesy of Zathrus13 poured a cloudy copper with a lasting amber head. Aromas of carmel, brown sugar, fruittiness and spice. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, brown sugar, clove, light banana and light bubblegum with a smooth lingering clove finish.

Darker reddish brown on the top of the glass, moving to a softer orange amber on the bottom, never seen that before.  Significant chunk in the glass and the head falls from three fingers to a thick sticky ring.  Mildewy cardboard kind of dampens the dark wheat notes and i cannot pick up anything else.  This dunkel has a punch and lacks clove or banana notes and is therefore simple which allows for the alcohol heat to finish uncontested.

Aroma of banana, clove, and some dark wheat malt and dark fruits. Pours a murky orange with some yeast sediment and no real head to speak of. Has flavors of strong banana and clove followed by wheat malt. Some other aspects of the beers were some tart citrus, dark fruits, chocolate, and apple. Bubbly carbonation and a tart mouth feel. Sweet and fruity.

12 ounce bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy dark copper color with lots of large floaties. 2-finger head shows nice retention and ok lacing. Big yeasty banana clove aroma. Taste is strong clove and other spice, yeast, wheat and banana. Medium bodied. Bristly feel with very vigorous carbonation.

[Bottle] Pours reddish amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is very nice banana, a little wheat, cloves and a touch of cinnamon--typical weizen bock, but done very well. Taste is initially quite sweet, then just the wheat and banana. Medium-thin mouthfeel with a decent finish. I love a good weizen bock, and that is what this was; good, but not quite great.

Pours a hazy bright orange with some yeast sediment. Awesome style -a wheat bock. Aroma and intial taste is like a great wheat beer like Franziskaner with lots of bananas and yeast and some additional spices of cloves like a witbier. But the end is more intense like a dobbelbock- sort of smokey and more full-bodied. Alcohol is completely hidden- I cannot believe this is 8.7 abv. Excellent save for the aftertaste, which is sometimes cardboard and sometimes battery acid. Very odd.

Pours a murky orange with a 1-2 finger creamy light tan head. The aroma shows banana, clove, wheaty, some phenol, mild alcohol, bubblegum. The favor is wheaty, clove, mildly spicy, some alcohol, banana. Clove and phenolic flavors show in the palate.

Bottle.  Poured a hazy setting sun color with a two finger off white head.  Aroma of yeast, fruit and typical wheat beer notes.  Flavor is spicy with some cloves and a hint of banana and apple.  Great beer.

Bottle thanks to Daniel. Pours a ruby, almost red-orange color, very bright indeed. A nice large white head and lots of lacing. A sweet aroma of dried fruits, lots of yeast, and wheat, bananas and cloves also. The taste is very good; initial yeast and zesty flavors, some cloves and other spices, bananas, lots of dried apples, dry wheat and other grains, some warmth and dryness in the finish. Very spicy for sure, but overall, a nice Autumn brew.
pours out a nice light brown color with decent head.  this was your typical wezien bock.  nothing special here.

Syrupy, clovey, banana bread and apricot nose.  Cloudy brown/orange color with a foamy long lasting head.  Licorice dried apricot syrup sweetness, with huge spicy bitter notes for balance.  Massive carbonation, medium body, long spicy finish, warming alcohol peaks at the very end.  Extremely flavorful beer with tons of spicy complexity--top notch!

12 ounce bottle in Weinstephaner weizen glass.  Nice reddish amber with long lasting head and lotsa lace, not quite as cloudy as expected depsite swirling.  NIce fruity mild banana peach earthy spicy aroma.  Toasty tangy caramel peach fruity sweetness with finishing wheaty tang.  Very soft mouthfeel, medium body, medium carbo.  Very nice all around.

Bottle. Aromas of moderate roasted for the malt, light herbs and lemon for the hops, moderate barnyard and musty for yeast, with hints of brown sugar and clove. Head is large, frothy, off-white, with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is murky light brown, like iced tea. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium, oily, with a soft to lively carbonation. It finishes lighly metallic. A nice warming Weizenbock, complex and well balanced.

This is a more tame, rebottled Golden Monkey, which isnt a bad thing.
Very spicy orange/brown color and taste, a downturned citrus flavor, possibly cloves that is carried blatantly and possibly proudly by alcohol, an odd vibration of sweetness and tartness.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours hazy dark amber and features a tight, creamy light tan head with great retention and nice lacing.  Aroma is yeasty and malty sweet with lots of soft banana and clove notes. Flavor is softly tart and quite spicy with a solid malt backbone.  Medium bodied and fairly smooth, highly carbonated.  Wow - this is 8.7%?  No clue...barely warming (although I am feeling the effects)!  Surprisingly nice and works great as a fall seasonal what with all the nicely balanced malt and spice.

12oz bottle. Pours a very cloudy, orangey brown with caramel-toffee-colored highlights and a thick, light tan head that fades quickly, though not completely, and leaves a thick swath of lace on the glass. The aroma is very doughy and yeasty with notes of banana and wheat. The flavor starts bready with some toasty melanoidins. Soft fruit, dark caramel, chocolate, and spices emerge next. At mid-palate, the spicy esters accentuate a spicy hop bitterness - a little more bitter than I expected for this style, but definitely pleasant. The finish is unexpectedly dry with a very subtle warming alcohol, spicy esters, fruity and spicy hop bitterness, and fresh baked bread. The mouthfeel is highly carbonated - brisk and a bit spritzy with lots of carbonation sting on the tongue (further accentuates spicy esters and finishing bitterness). After swirling around in the mouth, loads of gas are released and a thick and yeasty/slippery body is unveiled. Overall, a very decent and well-put-together weizenbock... but nothing really special (other than the fact that weizenbock is not a widely produced style). Alcohol is deftly hidden.

On tap at Jerrys. Dark caramel with big, creamy tan head / Dark fruit & caramel nose / Full bodied, sweet & malty, with long finish. Alcohol well masked / Flavors of dates, bananas, apples, bread, caramel, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg / Outstanding.

Nice slightly hazy pour with a moderate to small head.  Brown pour with a nice spice and malt aroma. Flavors of ripe dark fruit and bananas, but the heavy clove spiciness is a bit over powering.  It has a good mouth feel and a nice body. Lots of malt, yet it is not really a full bodied beer.  Enjoyable, but I feel the spice is a bit over the top.  Another good Victory ale.
Bottle. Pours deep, unclear, orange amber with a beige head. The aroma is fruity apple/banana, with clove and nutmeg. The flavor is well balanced with spicy clove notes and fruity banana. Very good.

Bottle poured into a glass. This beer suprised me. It has the victory taste which is a good thing but overall I definitely enjoyed it. Its hard to compare because I have delved into this family of beers but am looking forward to trying to others.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2008 Bottle.  Pours cloudy deep orange with a purplish reddish hue.  Foamy off white head with good retention.  Fruity, spicy (mostly clove), and yeasty wheat aromas.  Notes of bananas, toasted banana bread, and some slightly dusty earthiness.  Probably the wheatiest (grainiest-tasting) wheat beer I’ve had.  Definitely different from something like Schneider Aventinus, but still quite good.
Heavy clove on the nose, with some sweet malts.  The flavor is also dominated by clove, with some black pepper and a nice smoky aspect.  Surprising to find this beer weighs in at almost 9%.

12 oz. Hazy, reddish copper with a large and lasting head. Creamy frosting of lace on the glass. Spicy banana, wheat and bubblegum aromas. Flavor is the same, with maybe some light cocoa and toasted nut on the finish. Medium body is smoothish and dryish.

Pours a hazy, dank brown, forming huge off white foamy head.  Aroma of cloves, banana, malts, hops and nutmeg.  Flavour much of the same, some hoppy bitterness and spice come through.  A decent weizen bock beer, I like Brooklyner better, but I’d still gulp this one too.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Murky brown color with a huge tan head. Tons of boozy banana in the aroma. Very sweet. Banana and bubblegum with a bit of bread and alcohol at the finish. Sweet and enjoyable. A damn fine extremely sweet beverage.

pours murky mahogany brown with a thick sienna head. Aroma heavy with banana nut bread, bubblegum esters and citrus. Flavor is loads of spice, banana nut bread, light fruit, and citrus. Aftertaste of wheat, spice, fruit, a little alcohol warmth. oily and lightly carbonated. very drinkable!

Pours a murky brown with lots of floaties and a thick, off white head. Banana and clove aroma, with a bit of earthiness. Flavor is spicey, clovey, and very delicious. Some caramel, and a nice -carbonated mouthfeel. Alcohol is very well-hidden. Great beer.

Pours a murky dull orange/brown with a lovely thick creamy beige head.  Great weizenbock aroma, spicy, clove, sweet wheat and caramel, banana and some alcohol.  A great beer! and in a six-pack and 9%!   First taste is definitely a little bit hot, some sweet caramel, bitter alcohol, fermented banana, and light spices.  Lighter more watery body than expected in a weizen, still has that fine sizzling carbonation though.   So drinkable for 8.7%.  Love it! why does it have to be a seasonal though!!!
Pours a hazy amber color with not much head.  What is there disipates quickly.  Aroma is yeast and apricot.  Taste is crisp and spicey, slight cidery feel.  Lots of yeast taste.  A great beer.
hazy dark yellow with huge white head. falvor is very nice with the sweetness of the wheat and the some spicyness and depth of the additional barley  very nice

4/1/08 notes:  bottle.  Appearance is a muddy-apricot amber-orange with visible clumps.  Virtually no head, thin lacing.  Aroma is a unique combo of wheat, yeast, malt, ripe apricot, citrus, caramel, and other spices.  Taste is magnificent:  a blend of ommegangs spicy coriander-orange peel, yeast, rich malts, and other fruit.  Very impressive.  Finishes smooth and semi sweet which lingers in your mouth just the right length.  I found this beer simultaneously refreshing, unique, and complex.  Great job Victory!

12 oz bottle
I picked up a single of this since it has been a while since I have tried a weizenbock.  Because of that I was looking forward to giving this a try.  Coming from Victory my expectations were met in the form of a solid well made beer.  I dont know if I would pick up a six pack but having a few bottles around might be nice.
Aroma / Appearance - A short lived beige head graced a caramelized fluid body with hints of caramel, chocolate, topioca pudding and butterscotch.  It reminds me of a dessert tray.
Flavor / Palate - Dry apple cider spiked with a hint of caramel filled the mouth.  The overall impression was of Wurthers hard candy.  The biggest flaw was that towards the end it became cloying.  Other than this small weakness it is solid and enjoyable.

Notes from an on tap experience about a year and a half ago: "Victory moonglow: pumpkin, banana, clove, sweet malt and wheaty yeast nose, tiny hint of abv towards the finish, very sweet, smooth, and sticky palate, starts very bocky and ends hefey..."

Pours a translucent brown in color with plenty of "chunkies" floating around in the beer. Very nice inch and a half of frothy beige head. This looks nice. Smell is spice and yeast. Theres some definite spice in the taste as well, but I just cant seem to put my finger on it right now. Crisp and smooth on the mouthfeel. Plenty of lemon zest in the flavor as well. This would be an incredible spring time, beer garden beer on draft! Enjoyable!

12 oz. bottle pours a ruby orange red with a finger of off white frothy head that leaves sparse lacing as it dissipates. Aroma is spicy corriander with citrus and warm notes of pomegranate. Front palate is yeasty warming to a spicy raisin bread in the middle and finishing with caramel malts. More complex than I expected it to be. Another good beer by Victory. Paired nicely with spicy turkey tacos and stood up to them well.

Shared with HogTownHarry, Harrys bottle! Thanks Harry! Pours a muddy brown, tan colour with zero head. Aroma: Raisens and port, nuts and malt.  Flavour: Mild alcohol flavour, some slight bitterness there too, a hint of toffee and spice, nutmeg. Short finish. Not a bad brew at all (my face is flushing due to it though!) Thanks Harry!

Bottle (12oz).  Shared with garthicus, via trade with goldtwins.  Murky brick red with a small off-white head.  Really like that aroma - dry, musty wood bitterness, yeast and muted sweet caramel malt and cocoa.  Taste - same, sweeter with dry mocha, still woody and leafy, tartness creeps in to the malt in the finish.  Thin but chewy body, lightly acidic and carbonated, it tapers off a tad as it finishes, but quite tasty.

12oz bottle, purchased from Consumers Beverages in Buffalo (I think).  Best before date of August 08.  Pours a cloudy murky brown.  Nice spicy and yeasty aroma.  The mouthfeel is tingly upfront before giving way to the typical warm weizenbock flavours - though it feels less fulfilling than, say, an Aventinus.

bottle. pours an amber color with many large floaties, there is a one finger tan head on top. smells of citrus and wheat, a small amount of spice is detectable. the flavor is very fruity with some spices nipping at the tip of my tongue. finishes clean with some alcohol warmth.excellent head retention.  not much to look at but very tasty.
Cloudy medium brown color with tan head.  nice aroma smells citrusy.  Can taste the many tipes of spices nice balance
There are a lot of different flavors in here. Citrus, vanilla, fruits, and grains are all noticeable in this beer. Good balance, with just a bit of extra and unnecessary alcohol flavor in the finish.

12 oz bottle - Pours a cloudy medium amber/orange color, with a small, thin off white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma has light caramel, fair amount of clove, hints of apricot, bananna, pear, bubblegum, grains of paradise. Flavor is fairly malty, good amount of light caramel, touch of oak, clove, vanilla, faint metallic off note. Finish is balanced. Overall this is decent, but not all that interesting.

Pours with a cream, five-finger head, fades very slowly and leaves a good lace.   Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied.  Cloudy amber color with a lot of floaties.   Nose is yeasty.  Flavor is sweet, yeasty, some caramel. Higher ABV is hidden. $2.15 for a 12oz bottle from Colonial Spirits, Acton, MA

Pours a beautiful dark amber with a haze that suggests its mystery. Nice head that doesnt last too long and leaves little behind. Nose is extremely spicy and fruity, cant smell or taste the almost 9% alcohol. Tastes like a thick, spiced fruit drink, and yeast adds a distinct note. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2008 Hazy amber pour. Thin head, dissipates quickly. Fruit and yeast on the nose. Very smooth finish, creamy mouth feel. Tons of banana, some wheat and light spice. Dont taste the alcohol, but you can feel the warmth.

12oz bottle.  Hazy amber with a reddish tint.  Head was good sized, beige in color with some lasting lace.  Nose was mostly spiced with some dark fruits in the back drop.  Flavor was pretty sweet with hints of spice, caramel and yeast.  One of the better Weizen Bocks Ive had.

Bottle courtesy of kmweaver. Pours a cloudy caramel brown with a large, fluffy, beige head that laces nicely. The nose is of wheat, clove, apple, cinnamon and a touch of alcohol. Mmm... nice. Light-bodied and wheaty in texture the finish is clean and lightly dry with a bit of alcohol warmth. The flavor is of sweet, caramelized wheat malt and red apple with spicy notes of cloves, faint cinnamon and lightly peppery alcohol. This is a solid weizenbock, but its just a tad too hot for my tastes. Perhaps I should snag a bottle or two to see if this one would age well like Aventinus. Thanks again for sending this very interesting bonus, Ken.

Pours a standard orange with a thin even light tan head.  Big fruit in this nose!  Appley wheaty esters.  Creamy.  A hint of cinnamon?  Deep caramel for the style.  Smooth with low carbonation.  A bit viscous.  Deep caramel under some substantial wheaty esters.  A bit alcoholic.  Nice round malt throughout makes it all work.  Like apple pie with pears in it.  I may pick this up again.

Pours a amber color with a head that quickly diminishes and no lacing. A good amount of sediment. It appears syrupy in the glass and has the same mouthfeel. Aroma has just a tiny hint of tartness, but mostly sweet with lots of spice and fruit, some alcohol (but not too much). Flavor is sweet with alcohol presence but not overpowering. slick mouthfeel with mostly citrusy spice dominating the palate.

12 oz. bottle from Secret Santa (winter 07) off of Want List.  Enjoy by Aug 29, 2008.  Pour is orange-amber, with a lot of suspended sediment and particulates.  Large, 4 inch off white head tops the beer.  Aroma of wheat, candy banana sweetness and some citrus.  Taste is the wheat, grainy, and more of the banana sweetness.  The finish has some spicy bitterness, faint alcohol burn  and some distant metallic sourness.  Interesting, and certainly not terrible, just didnt really completely do it for me.  Thanks for giving me a chance ot try this one Santa!

A staple at my place during the fall. This is a very authentic representation of a Weizenbock. Banana and cloves abound the aroma and flavor. Thick, chewy mouthfeel. Very complex, yet surprisingly drinkable and thirst quenching.

Pours dark amber with a thin head. Predominately malt aroma with clove and nutmeg spices in the background. The malts predominate the taste with some banana and clove as well. There is a bit of spiciness in the after taste to round it out. Some tingling carbonation is also present.
Zippy, yeasty, tart, slightly sour.  Smells exactly like it tastes.  Not a modest beer.  A little harsh.  Not a beer for me, but a top-quality brew.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours cloudy amber with gold hues.  Thick, white cream head.  big ol weizenbock nose, touch of banana with big carmel maltiness.  Thick, creamy mouthfeel with bubblegum and banana notes, then a HUGE kick of alcohol.  Muddled in there somewhere is a clove and ginger spiciness.  Cant get over the alcohol.  It seems everpresent, giving it this huge bite at the end that sorta makes you cringe, but in a good way, like if you found out that World of Warcraft was actually a "world" and you really were a "dark elf incarnation of Mr. T".  I digress.  This isnt a bad beer, just needed to round out a bit.  Theres a lot going on in there, and its unfortunate that the alcohol masks it and makes you really dig.  I pity it, like a fool.

Bottle from the rip and run.  Thanks to whomever tipped the six pack to the floor enabling me to purchase this as a single from Apu.  It on clearance,  one dollah"  Nose is wheat-beerific.  some light spiceness as well.  Medium body is smooth and robust.  finish is all wheat malt.  Cloudy amber brwn in the glass.  a bit on thte average side for me from Victory.
Fruity aroma with some spice and honey.  Sweet dark fruity flavor with a spiced finish.  Smooth, medium bodied mouth feel.  Will definately have this one again.
Thick dark orange color with big off-white head.  Fruity with notes of honey on the nose.  Somewhat sweet up front, then it turns to a nice sour that was great.  Finish was crisp and clean.

THOUGHTS: A truely different beer. While I think Victory makes some good beers, Im not a huge fan, but this beer goes beyond good to great. Hides alc incredibly well. The yeast is very nice. The flavors in this one were not always the ones I am most pleased with, but here they all worked together to make a great beer. It was almost like a barley wine and a dunkleweizen had a baby.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a cloudy, almost glowing, medium orangish brown with a small to average, off-white head that kept a thin sheet. The aroma was lighlty yeasty with red wine, honey, some fruitiness and a lot of spice a little alcohol and light milk chocolate. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and moderately acidic, while the finish was moderately sweet and sour. The flavors were red wine, spice, some yeast, slight chocolate, dark fruit, wheat and a little more yeast. The medium body was somewhat creamy with fizzy carbonation and a lighlty astringent and lightly astringent and somewhat chalky finish.

12oz  bottle @ Rustico in Alexandria, VA.  Pours orange with an apple juice look.  Nose is wheaty and either has a bit of apple in it or Im loosing my mind.  Taste is nice, sweet, fruity, floral and overall very very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2007 Great beer. It is a very attractive golden orange with chunky sediment floating around. The beer pours like syrup and has a beautifully full mouthfeel and body to it. Great and crisp beer.
One of the best Victory beers, plain and simple.  Unfiltered and dyeasty, the dark wheat beer true to the German style....a full flavored, but not heavy beer.

Pours a deep amber with a white head.   Smells sweet and spicy.  It really has a that nice wheat flavor full of autumn flavor.  I dont know how else to describe it but it just makes you think of the changing of the seasons.  Notes of the alcohol in the finish.
Chunky, murky pour with a honey color.  Off white head.  Fruity aroma.  Taste is a mix of fruit and cloves.  Not really what I expected from this style, but very good.
From a bottle poured amber color with a fair amount of head.  Nice malty/hoppy flavor with a good finish.

Bottle.  Pour is a cloudy brown wtih a large, tan head.  Aromas are of dried fruit, spices, pears and some sweetness.  Flavor is very spicy... an interesting mix of white pepper, coriander, anise, cloves, etc. with a lot of yeast and sweet sugary and fruity notes.  Alcohol provides a bit of a bite and some pretty nice warmth throughout.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Great beer. Complex spicy and fruity flavor. Some yeast and sweetness as well. Balanced flavor, light carbonation, and full mouthfeel. The alcohol is well hidden. Surprisingly drinkable for a stronger beer, I could drink these all night.

A very nice weizenbock. I thought I was done with these for the yeat, but Im glad I picked this up. Pour was a beautiful hazy dark copper with a huge fluffy off 3 finger off white head that stayed the whole drink. Aroma of yeast, spice and light caramel malts. Taste was very peppery. Strong yeastiness and carbonation that lets the malt spices do the work to the taste buds. Very spicy and different for this style. Nice!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Ive had hefeweizens.  Ive had bocks.  But this is the first Weizen Bock Ive ever tried.  The alcohol content is what interested me.  Im not typically used to wheat beers that pack a punch.  For about 80% of my experience I could taste nothing but corn, corn, and more corn for some reason.  The last sip is the sweetest for the bottom is where all the alcohol tends to sit.

A nice beer in a very underappreciated style.  Pours a beautiful dark copper color with a thin head.  Very nice haze and even carbonation.  Wonderful mixture of spices and fruits on the nose and a fabulous blend of malty fruity flavors.  First beer from Victory that Ive really been a big fan of.  Excellent beer.

Bottle from zathrus13.  Hazy amber with thick white head. Subtle aroma of banana and perhaps some yeast can be perceived.  Fruity flavors of banana and wild berries (strawberries?) takes you up front. Then you get some biscuit and caramel notes. Pretty refreshing for a 8.7% beer. This is a nice one! Thanks Jeff!
Excellent beer. Another great product from Victory.  If the alcohol could be covered up a tiny bit better, i this beer would kick my ass every time

Pours an almost purple brown.  The aroma is very fruity and yeasty.  I could detect a hint of berries when the head was very full.  The flavor is a tad spicy with a yeasty weizen flavor.  The note of berries and autumn air is subtle and refeshing.

Ah yes, Victorys Moonglow. I remember when this was first released at he brewpub,what a fine beer it was. All you could ask for in a weizen bock, fruity,yeasty, rich and full bodied. Now, its just a shell of its former self. Still has the fruity, yeasty, bananna flavors, but they are toned down and the body is less cloudy. STOP FILTERING YOU BEERS YOU ARE KILLING THEM!!!!!!!
Spicy yeast aroma. Cloudy amber-brown color with a largish head, diminishing with time. Mild dark malty start finishing with a tangy malt flavor.

cloudy reddish yellow amber color with a medium off white head....sweet rich sugary aroma, yeast and sweet malt....sweet taste with a thick mouthfeel...spices/cloves, slight alcolhol in the finish...nice and mellow beer

Bottled (2005, thanks jjpm74!). Hazy amber colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is wheat, hops, raisins, alcohol and some hints of malts. Flavour is alcohol, hops, grass and some caramel & raisins. Pleasant.

Bottled vintage 2005
Hazy dark nutty brown, small off-white head. Ryeish, bready, a bit wheaty with "American nose". Banana, bread, toffee ... lacks the power of Aventinus, but quite tasty.

Pours a dark amber with a medium sized whitish head.  I was quite impressed by this wheat beer styled beverage. Aromas of fruit, wheat, and banana are present throughout the drink, and the flavors are excellent. The alcohol is very carefully masked until it warms towards the end.
UPDATED: OCT 12, 2014 Fruity aroma with hints of cloves.  Large foamy head cloudy amber color.  Flavor was sweet, fruity, and spicy with a  alcohol aftertaste.  A very unique beer.

Pours a dark amber with a small, slightly off-white head. My first bavarian wheat style beer, didnt enjoy at first, but have grown to love.

Slightly sweet with just a tinge of bite, and a slightly cherry aroma and flavor. All in all a good beer, and a good new style for me.

Fully clouded, firey red-orange pour.  Retains the last layer of a towering white head.  Aroma is a hot spark of wheat and bubblegum, sagebrush and clove; typical as it comes, but executed well.  Bright pear sugar and banana toward the end, with some red pepper and melon.  Fairly dirty taste of orange rind, a whiff of urinal and rubbing alcohol.  Fruit cocktail sugar and dark earthy malts lilt back and forth rather uneasily.  The sweet alcohol bite carries a cringe of fusel and thin whiskey.  A light suggestion of pineapple.  Sprightly carbonation overrides a bit of bloody greasiness in the texture; medium-bodied and oddly polished.  Finishes on cleaning product and pistachio oil.  Mild afterburn of bitterness.  A pleasantly earthy disposition, though with a lot of synthetics.  Geared heavily to the wheat, lacking balance.

Pours a clouded amber brown with no head.Sediment swirling around. Oops. Should have made a more careful pour.Nose is like cherry wood. Thick and meaty. Sugars and an overall deep red fruit scent. Flavor is meaty too. Nice even sweetness. Feel is low on bubble and thicker and syrupy liquid feel hits your tongue. Very drinkable. Definitely a good brew.

12 oz. bottle harkens back to a good old aventinus.  Aroma is decidedly brown sugar with a hint of banana, but could be stronger.  Pours with almost no head Nice deep caramel color.  Feels wet around mouth with lots of carbonation and medium-full body.  Just a little abrasive on throat.  Tastes of banana more than anything but with brown sugar and caramel.  Almost like a mild bananas foster wthout the butter.

MMMMM GOOD. This is a unique brew...a blend of a bock and its characteristic sweetness with the banana clovey taste of a wheat. I liked it. Poured golden brown (like apple cider) with HUGE head that took forever to go down. Beauty beer. The taste was well balanced and unique...very sweet. Ill go back to this one. A Victory for your taste, indeed!

Bottle picked up in Plainfield, IL.  Shared with Duane.  If my memory serves me well, I think I discovered (after I bought it of course) that this bottle was about 3 years old.  Slightly fruity aroma.  Kind of tasted like a bock, but there was something off about it.  Probably because the bottle was so old.  Id like to try this fresh and rerate.
